remarks: Express a function ` F ` whose value ` B ` may not always be a set in terms of another function ` G ` for which sethood is guaranteed.  (Note that ` ( _I `` B ) ` is just shorthand for ` if ( B e. _V , B , (/) ) ` , and it is always a set by ~ fvex .)  Note also that these functions are not the same; wherever ` B ( C ) ` is not a set, ` C ` is not in the domain of ` F ` (so it evaluates to the empty set), but ` C ` is in the domain of ` G ` , and ` G ( C ) ` is defined to be the empty set.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jul-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 23-Apr-2014.)
statement:
fvmptex.1 $e |- F = ( x e. A |-> B ) $.
fvmptex.2 $e |- G = ( x e. A |-> ( _I ` B ) ) $.
fvmptex $p |- ( F ` C ) = ( G ` C ) $.
$d A x $.
